title: Paedophile Dean Petley paid two women £3,000 to sexually assault children online pleads guilty
text:
Dean Peatley (police mugshot pictured), 30, paid two women a total of £3,000 over a number of years to sexually assault children so he could watch

A paedophile paid two women to sexually abuse children so he could watch it for his own sick pleasure, a court heard.

Dean Petley, 30, paid Jodie Little, who called herself 'devil b**** 666' on an adult services website, £750 so he could watch her assault two children.

He paid another woman £2,285 over three years to sexually abuse a little girl.

Petley, a car engineer from Leamington Spa, was arrested last October after the National Crime Agency traced Little, who committed her sickening crimes while living in Cyprus.

Little, of Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, was jailed for 12 years and four months in August.

National Crime Agency (NCA) investigators became aware of Little, who was providing webcam services to paedophile perverts to bear witness to her abuse.

Petley was arrested last October after being identified as one of Little's customers.

Online chats extracted from Little's computer show Petley demanded that she perform sex acts in front of young children.

Little had sent Petley 10 files, one of which showed her sexually abusing a very young child and talking about another child being raped.

Examinations of Petley's hard drive also showed him watching another woman abusing a young girl.

Five indecent images of children were also found on the drive.

Petley pleaded guilty to 11 charges at Isleworth Crown Court yesterday.

Now he faces years behind bars when he is sentenced next month.

The unnamed woman has also been charged, but has not yet entered a plea.

Dean Peatley, 30, paid Jodie Little (police mugshot pictured), who called herself 'devil b**** 666' on an adult services website, £750 so he could watch her assault two children

Jason Booth, NCA operations manager, said: 'These are utterly abhorrent crimes and are examples of what the NCA is increasingly seeing with ever worsening cyber-enabled child sexual offending.

'The NCA knows that the scale and severity of offending against children are worsening.

'We and UK police arrest around 500 child sex offenders a month and safeguard about 700 children a month.'

He added: 'There is no greater priority for us than protecting children.

'This investigation was possible because of our determination to make Jodie Little face justice.

'Distance is not a barrier for us in pursuing UK child sex offenders wherever they are.'

An NSPCC spokesman added: 'Young children have endured unthinkable abuse for Petley's sexual gratification.

'This disturbing case clearly demonstrates that behind every child abuse image or video that appears online, there are vulnerable victims who have been subjected to appalling pain and suffering.

'Sickening offenders like Petley are fuelling this evil industry, and it is crucial that more is done by Government and tech companies to prevent this material being published.'

Anyone concerned about a child can contact the NSPCC Helpline on 0808 800 5000, while Childline is there for young people on 0800 1111 or via www.childline.org.uk
